newsitem.title: USA: US Midwest direct hogs seen mostly steady - dealers.
newsitem.headline: US Midwest direct hogs seen mostly steady - dealers.

text.p: U.S. Midwest direct cash hog prices Friday were seen mostly steady, instances $0.50 lower, amid ideas that pork prices were poised to recover from recent declines, livestock dealers said.
Top prices for interior Iowa and southern Minnesota hogs delivered to plants could range $48.00 to $49.50 per cwt and Illinois top prices could range $49.00 to $50.00.
Indiana/Ohio top prices at plants were seen ranging from $49.50 to $50.00.
The prospect for stronger pork prices could boost packer operating margins and spur higher cash hog bids, they said.

Fresh hams at midday were quoted by USDA at mixed prices with lean trimmings selling $1.00-$3.00 per cwt higher. Loin prices were not established. There were 33.5 loads of pork cuts and 9.0 loads of trimmed, processed pork sold, USDA said. Pork cut-out values Wednesday were down $3.25 from a week ago.
Hog prices could be supported by projections for a slowdown in hog runs as producers may hold back some animals in opposition to this week's lower prices, some dealers said.
Interior Iowa/southern Minnesota top hog prices at the plant Thursday were $50.00, down $3.50 from a week ago, USDA statistics showed.
